meanings.definition: To pack or store (goods) in a specified place.
meanings.sent1: She was stowing her clothes in the suitcase for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse worker was stowing boxes on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was stowing nuts in its hiding spot for winter.
meanings.sent4: He was stowing away memories in his heart like treasures.
meanings.sent5: The chef was stowing away secret ingredients for the special dish.

meanings.definition: To put away or arrange (items) neatly and tidily.
meanings.sent1: He was stowing his toys in the toy chest after playing.
meanings.sent2: She was stowing her books on the shelf in alphabetical order.
meanings.sent3: The cat was stowing its toys under the bed for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: She was stowing away her worries in a mental drawer.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was stowing away his tools after a long day of work.

meanings.definition: The action of packing or storing items in a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The stowing of supplies in the pantry was well organized.
meanings.sent2: The stowing of luggage in the overhead compartment was efficient.
meanings.sent3: The stowing of toys in the toy box was a daily routine for the child.
meanings.sent4: The stowing of memories in her mind was like filling a treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: The stowing of files in the cabinet made the office look neat and tidy.
